result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elijah Malik Weary

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elijah Malik Weary not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Elijah Malik Weary.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elijah Malik Weary not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Elijah Malik Weary.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel needs discovery and offer and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel, received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DJR (dob 10/09/2001).  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Elijah Malik Weary in court with attorney Margo Elise Clark.  Defendant Elijah Malik Weary in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elijah Malik Weary appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to the inake calendar of the week, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY AND IS NOT ON A VOP HOLD.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
